text: The seven-spot ladybird (Coccinella septempunctata) is a colourful beetle. It has red back (wing cases) with seven black spots, black and white head, legs and stomach. As an adult it is 5-8 mm long.Seven-spot ladybird (Coccinella septempunctata) ARKive Coccinella septempunctata is the most common lady beetle in Europe. Because it eats harmful insects, people have imported it to North America.Coccinella septempunctata Animal Diversity Web. Accessed December 14, 2015 Ladybirds are members of the family Coccinellidae, which is in the infraorder Cucujiformia. == References == Category:Polyphaga Category:National symbols of Finland
title: Coccinella septempunctata
